intro: Pimpinella dioicarossica, commonly known as the two-sexed carrot. This plant is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in cool, temperate climates. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into dry, ribbed fruits. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for studying plant morphology and reproductive strategies.
